com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.saf.handler
Interface IBindingHandler

All Superinterfaces:
IHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBindingHandler
public interface IBindingHandler
extends IHandler

All Binding handlers such as SCA, Web service, stateless session EJB, data base stored procedure, EIS which provide different kinds of binding types must implement this interface. Most handlers should extend the abstract class AbstractBindingHandler which provides default behavior for a number of methods.

Little background on Bindings:
Bindings are used by services and references. References use bindings to describe the access mechanism used to call an external service (which can be a service provided by another SCA composite).

Services use bindings to describe the access mechanism that clients (which can be a client from another SCA composite) have to use to call the service. SCA supports the use of multiple different types of bindings on same Service or Reference.

createBindingFor

org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.datamodel.IDataModelOperation createBindingFor(com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Service service)
                                                                                 throws SAFException,
                                                                                        java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                                        InvalidOperationException
Adds a binding of the kind supported by this handler to the specified Service object, based on the specified service file and the interfaces in the external service definition. The handler is expected to return WTP operation that when executed will update the Service definition, if necessary. If the Service has an existing binding, the handler can add to or replace the binding. The handler can use the callback to query for more information from the user. If the binding requires associated files, this method should generate those files. In this case, this method should be aware that the files it generates may replace some already being managed in a team environment. The Service object should have a resource associated with it. The handler can use this location to generate relative file references if needed or use the location for storing binding-related files that need to be generated. The resource can be retrieved by casting the Reference object to an EObject and calling EObject.eResource().

Parameters:
service - an existing Service definition, which may contain interfaces and binding(s)
Returns:
an IDataModelOperation instance that, once executed by the caller, creates the new binding for the Service passed
Throws:
SAFException - An unexpected exception occurred.
InvalidOperationException - A binding cannot be created for the given Reference/Service.
java.lang.InterruptedException - The caller did not provide a callback object needed by the handler, or the callback request was canceled or aborted.

createBindingFor

org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.datamodel.IDataModelOperation createBindingFor(com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Reference reference)
                                                                                 throws SAFException,
                                                                                        java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                                        InvalidOperationException
Adds a binding of the kind supported by this handler to the specified Reference object, based on the specified service file and the interfaces in the external service definition. The handler is expected to update the Reference/Service definition, if necessary. If the Reference/Service has an existing binding, the handler can add to or replace the binding. The handler can use the callback to query for more information from the user. If the binding requires associated files, this method should generate those files. In this case, this method should be aware that the files it generates may replace some already being managed in a team environment. The ExternalService object should have a resource associated with it. The handler can use this location to generate relative file references if needed or use the location for storing binding-related files that need to be generated. The resource can be retrieved by casting the Reference object to an EObject and calling EObject.eResource().

Parameters:
reference - an existing Reference/Service definition, which may contain interfaces and a binding
Returns:
an IDataModelOperation instance that, once executed by the caller, creates the new external service binding
Throws:
SAFException - An unexpected exception occurred.
InvalidOperationException - A binding cannot be created for the given Reference/Service.
java.lang.InterruptedException - The caller did not provide a callback object needed by the handler, or the callback request was canceled or aborted.
